Detailed Description

Reply to a .TrafficPointRequestPacket After the normal header the request packet contains: {tabular}{lll} { Pos} & { Size} & { Destription} \ {tabular}.

bool TrafficPointReplyPacket::addID (  uint32  ID  ) 
 

Add an ID.

Parameters:
ID The new ID, that should be added to the packet.
type The type of the item.
Returns:
True if the item was added, false if packet was full.

uint32 TrafficPointReplyPacket::getID (  uint32  index  )  const
 

Returns an ID.

Parameters:
index The cardinal number of the ID to return. Valid values are 0 <= index < getNumberIDs().
Returns:
ID number index. MAX_UINT32 is returned upon error.

uint32 TrafficPointReplyPacket::getMapID (   )  const
 

Get the ID of the map where the items are located.

Returns:
ID of the map.

uint32 TrafficPointReplyPacket::getNumberIDs (   )  const
 

The amount IDs in the reply.

Use the method isMapIDs()# to find out if it is IDs of maps or items.

Returns:
The number of IDs in this packet.

bool TrafficPointReplyPacket::isMapIDs (   )  const
 

Tells if the IDs are MapIDs or ItemIDs.

Returns:
True if this packet contains IDs of maps, false otherwise.

void TrafficPointReplyPacket::setMapID (  uint32  mapID  ) 
 

Set the mapID of this reply.

If set to MAX_UINT32 the content is beleaved to be MapIDs otherwise ItemIDs.

Parameters:
mapID The ID of the map where the items are located.

void TrafficPointReplyPacket::setNumberIDs (  uint32  newNbrIDs  )  [private]
 

Set the number of items to a new value.

Parameters:
newNbrIDs The new value of the number of items.
